messages.message:
During the review stage of ground truth dataset values, the column header row shown in the UI is a little bit confusing.

Shown in SS1, the header row (row 1 on the extracted table view on the right of the UI) seems to be a duplicate row. So, I delete row 2 (the perceived duplicate row). SS2 shows deleting the row, and SS3 shows *the confusing behavior:* *The header row is just a second rendering of the actual first row of the table and I'm not sure why* :lil_nervous: 

I can see a case for bolding the first row (line 1 indicated in the UI, for example, could be bold), but I know that sometimes there may be no header row where bolding may not make sense. I'm not sure what I'd like to see, but it is a little bit confusing.

Yah this is an unfortunate part of the table editor. Essentially we can't edit the actual headers but headers need to be editable by users so we repeat it on the first row.

Ideally i agree this should not be the case!
I think there is already a ticket for some table editor ux improvements and this is definitely one of them.
